references.text: Waypoints Vol 05: PPL/CPL Air Law. Chapter 3: The Pilot

questions.question: Part 91 says that the pilot-in-command must be satisfied the aircraft is in an airworthy and in a condition for safe flight after inspecting what two things?
questions.answer: The aircraft documents, and the aircraft itself.

questions.question: Who is responsible for the safe operation of the aircraft and safety of its occupants?
What should the PIC do if they experience any defects during the pre-flight inspection or during flight?
questions.answer: Record them in the technical log (or other document acceptable to the Director).

questions.question: Who is responsible for nominating the pilot-in-command?
questions.answer: The aircraft operator (the person who causes or permits the aircraft to fly).

questions.question: How is PIC designated for aircraft that require more than one pilot? (Who makes the decision, and when should it be made?)
questions.answer: The operator (person who causes or permits the aircraft to fly) designates the PIC for each period of the flight when the flight is planned.
